definition.para: Date of creation of the resource.
If the resource is a photograph, the date the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the date the artwork was created.

instructions.para: If the date when the image/resource in hand was produced is known, and is different from that of the original image, so note in the Notes field. The date should be a specific year. If the date is unknown, an attempt should be made to assign an approximate date, using the form "ca." (circa).

In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes and should be user-friendly. The Dates field is indexed, enabling searching (see that entry for details). Specific dates (e.g., September 12, 1933; June 1912) should be entered in this field, and should also be incorporated in the Title field.

history.justification: We need a display dates field that will be easy for users to understand. It does not need to be indexed but it seems OK to map to Dublin Core.
